intro: Anisopus exellii, commonly known as the Cape sugarbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and maritime climates. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Anisopus exellii is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
